thread.title: Graham says Trump could face impeachment if he brings back waterboarding
thread.title_full: Graham says Trump could face impeachment if he brings back waterboarding

title: Graham says Trump could face impeachment if he brings back waterboarding
text:
Graham says Trump could face impeachment if he brings back waterboarding 
“You have said several times he is not above the law,” Sen. Lindsey O. Graham (R-S.C.) told Judge Neil Gorsuch, referring to President Trump. 
“If you start waterboarding, you may be impeached,” Graham said of Trump, noting that this form of torture is not permitted under current law. Trump has said that “torture works.” 
“Senator, the impeachment power belongs to this body,” said Gorsuch, declining to affirm Graham’s position. 
The judge added, as he mentioned earlier in the hearing: “No man is above the law.” Share via Email The inside track on Washington politics. Be the first to know about new stories from PowerPost. Sign up to follow, and we’ll e-mail you free updates as they’re published. You’ll receive free e-mail news updates each time a new story is published. You’re all set! Neil Gorsuch confirmation hearings: Updates and analysis on the Supreme Court nominee Gorsuch appears before the Senate Judiciary Committee on Monday. (Michael Reynolds/EPA) 
Judge Neil Gorsuch, a federal appeals court judge from Colorado, is on Capitol Hill today for confirmations hearings for a seat on the Supreme Court. Gorsuch was nominated by President Trump to fill the seat left open by the death of Antonin Scalia and has broad support among Republicans. 
It’s a chance for Senate Democrats to take a stand against the Trump administration, and express their anger that Republicans blocked a hearing for President Barack Obama’s selection for the seat, Judge Merrick Garland of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit. 
Monday is the beginning of four days of hearings. Follow along.
